place.name: WEELEY
place.gazetteerText: WEELEY, a parish, with an ancient village, in Tendring district, Essex; on the Tendring Hundred railway, 10½ miles ESE of Colchester. It has a post-office‡ under Colchester, and a r. station. Acres, 2,087. Real property, £4,105. Pop., 630. Houses, 146. The property is much subdivided. Barracks and a garrison were here during the war with France. Bricks and tiles are made. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Rochester. Value, £580.* Patron, Brasenose College, Oxford. The church is good; and there are two Methodist chapels and a national school. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
